fields.title: Colorist in Wartime
fields.abstract: An Iraqi painter and colorist who has been living in exile for 30 years in Rome, provides this portrait

fields.title: A Syrian Love Story
fields.abstract: Two political prisoners in pre-Arab Spring Syria end up falling in love and are forced from their home later, because of political shifts and a country lingering on the brink of civil war

fields.title: Rukan
fields.abstract: Comparing the image ISIS publicly portrays through propaganda with interviews of refugees, the filmmaker uses those stories to paint a bleak picture of life under their rule

fields.title: Lucio
fields.abstract: One man, in the 1970's, was able to take tens of millions of dollars from a bank using fake checks, all to help those who were suffering, including refugees

fields.title: The Suffering Grasses
fields.abstract: After the Arab Spring, Syria fell deep into a civil war that still rages on today, the refugees in the film are just a few of the millions who have suffered because of this conflict

fields.title: Returning Home: Revival of a Bosnian Village
fields.abstract: Internally displaced Bosniak and Croat refugees come to respect each other because of their commonality of being internally displaced even though some occupy other's houses

fields.title: Theatre & War
fields.abstract: Internally displaced refugees seeking refuge in a Beirut theatre, get a deep appreciation of the power of the arts

fields.title: The Invisible Man
fields.abstract: Illegal refugee immigrants who were persecuted for the sexual orientation by their families and the government have to face the sad reality of having to leave their homeland for safety in other countries

fields.title: Peace Effort in Vukovar
fields.abstract: Refugees who wish to return back to their rightful home after the war in Former Yugoslavia find their homes occupied by those they once fought with

fields.title: Croatia E(n)d-en on Earth
fields.abstract: 300 asylum-seeking refugees in Croatia struggle to get recognition, two years after the country signed an asylum law into power

fields.title: Libya: The Migrant Trap
fields.abstract: In the violent political vacuum of post-Ghaddafi Libya, refugees from all over the world face major human rights violations in refugee camps and on their journeys there

fields.title: Hopeless in Sweden
fields.abstract: Over 300 ethnically Hungarian migrants, mostly from Roma background, who want to seek asylum in Sweden

fields.title: Africa 11
fields.abstract: Asylum seeking refugees who seek integration in Austria through participating and pursuing a future within the game of soccer

fields.title: Island 36
fields.abstract: Refugees  in a German refugee camp focusing on advocating asylum law in order to receive better rights for refugees and migrants

fields.title: Waiting...
fields.abstract: Illegal refugees in France, who face violence and difficulties from immigration officials, are seeking to someday reach England to work and gain asylum

fields.title: Homeless Kids
fields.abstract: The narratives of children refugees who hope to someday go out beyond the walls of the refugee camp they're living in within Belgium

fields.title: Playground
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugee who is waiting to hear about his asylum status. Over the course of two years, he discusses his daily life, challenges, and fears are while living in France

fields.title: The Arrivals
fields.abstract: Discusses the struggles, fears, and constant waiting that refugee families go through during the asylum process in France, while also dealing with very overwhelmed and understaffed asylum offices

fields.title: Farid: In Zurich or Somewhere
fields.abstract: Rejected asylum-seeking refugees who face the ultimate fear and worry of a future deportation either back to their country of origin or a safe third country

fields.title: The Fortress
fields.abstract: A Swiss transit camp hosts over 200 asylum-seeking people who struggle with the inconsistent nature of the asylum application process by those running the camp

fields.title: Life in Paradise: Illegals in the Neighborhood
fields.abstract: In a remote European village, officials build a housing complex for rejected asylum-seekers and illegal immigrants, turning the small village into a microcosm of the broader world

fields.title: No Way Back
fields.abstract: Being an unaccompanied minor on a refugee trail is hard enough, it gets even worse when these children get stuck at sea for days trying to get to Australia

fields.title: Mimoune
fields.abstract: Shows the hardship of family division as an illegal refugee and the fight to reunify by one family

fields.title: Reaching Albion
fields.abstract: This short documentary features interviews with refugees stuck in Calais, France try to reach the United Kingdom

fields.title: Wanakam
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking Tamil refugees who are facing the rigorous asylum process within Switzerland struggle to get granted asylum and to get through the process

fields.title: Special Flight
fields.abstract: Rejected asylum seekers who are forcibly being removed from Switzerland on "Special Flights" which are known to be dehumanizing ways of exiting refugees back to their country of origin

fields.title: Nowhere in Europe: Escaping Chechnya for Europe
fields.abstract: Refugees and Asylum-seekers escaping the violence in Chechnya to head towards Western Europe face many unique difficulties that are portrayed in the film

fields.title: Fortress Europe
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from: Chechnya, Russia, Bulgaria, Moldova, Kazakhstan, Iran, Philippines, China and Iraq who are looking for a better life in Europe

fields.title: Vakha and Magomed
fields.abstract: Two Chechen refugees, who have sought asylum in Warsaw, Poland, have developed a good relationship, which the film focuses on rather than focusing on their past

fields.title: Can't be Silent: On Tour with the Refugees
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees, also originating from The Gambia, Somalia, and Iran, who look to music and performance to freely express themselves when a majority of their liberties- particularly the freedom to move around freely throughout Germany, are restricted

fields.title: Hope
fields.abstract: A refugee who survives a boat sinking that killed over 400 other refugees, then spends the rest of her life telling her story

fields.title: A Nun's New Habit
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from Iraq and Iran placed in detention centers in Australia face challenges and harassment within the refugee center and in society

fields.title: 300 Miles to Heaven
fields.abstract: In this accurate dramatization of a daring escape by two boys from communist Poland to Denmark, the boys soon learn the world outside communism can also be harsh and sometimes unforgiving

fields.title: Bosnia, Bosnia!
fields.abstract: Refugees who were rescued from a psychiatric ward in Bosnia during the war in Former Yugoslavia have been in a makeshift refugee camp for the past 17 years in Hungary

fields.title: Document: Hoyerswerda I Frontex
fields.abstract: The story of racial attacks on refugees that happened in Hoyerswerda (East Germany) on four people from Mozambique in 1991 and those who tried to help them, also showcases the difference between immigration policy then and now

fields.title: LogBook_Serbistan
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees who are seeking all opportunities to arrive in Europe and face major hardships and humiliations; the fiction film shadows the restrictive nature of Europe's immigration policies

fields.title: Caught Between Two Worlds
fields.abstract: Four people, from four different countries and cultures have the commonality of being refugees in Hungary stuck in a transition camp to prepare them for life in Hungary

fields.title: Children in Exile: Recollections of Childhood
fields.abstract: Under the Soviet government during World War II, there were many victims of atrocities committed by the government on its own people, this film focuses on just the youngest among those victims

fields.title: Saved By Words
fields.abstract: The story of a refugee escaping from Iraq and waiting to receive a residency permit and shows the hardship and challenges of being an immigrant refugee into Europe and leaving your family and identity behind

fields.title: Voices in Transit
fields.abstract: Identities can quickly change and become lost through the asylum-seeking process, particularly when certain countries aren't receptive to refugees at all

fields.title: The Immigration Judge
fields.abstract: From the perspective of immigration judges- shows their various, daily dilemmas while deciding the fates of immigrants and refugees within Amsterdam

fields.title: Houses
fields.abstract: The film showcases refugees from the former Yugoslavia and the struggles they face in a refugee camp in Hungary

fields.title: The Eye of the Needle
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from Macedonia and Bosnia work to understand and follow the order of the Swedish and European migration policy.

fields.title: Those
fields.abstract: When a new refugee camp is opened a few miles away from a small Hungarian village, the villagers have mixed reactions, with some resorting to violence and protests

fields.title: The Unwanted
fields.abstract: The Bulgarian authorities forced the migration of 1 million ethnic Turks to Turkey if they refused to change their names into Bulgarian ones. Over 350,000 individuals fled the country and Turkey close their borders, leaving many people divided

fields.title: Between the Lines
fields.abstract: This film focuses on the detention and "illegal" status of immigrants specifically in New Delhi and the often harsh situations they faced away from their families

fields.title: Outside of Europe
fields.abstract: Because of the EU's often strict immigration/refugee policy, many trying to get in through Ukraine end up at two refugee centers on the Ukrainian side of the border, hoping to someday get into the EU

fields.title: Shafiq Monis in Australia
fields.abstract: Narrative of an Afghan man caught by the Taliban for drawing and painting, which is considered a crime under their command. He soon after fled the country and is detained in a refugee center in Australia

fields.title: Free Inside...Gypsies and Swiss
fields.abstract: Discusses internally-displaced Yenish people, a majority of which were young children, within Switzerland who were forced from their homes to participate in "re-education" programs
fields.notes: Donation from OSI-Budapest Arts and Culture Program

fields.title: My Room is My Best Friend
fields.abstract: Minor asylum-seekers from Poland, Afghanistan, Iraq, Philippines, Tajikistan, and China, express their feelings and thoughts of living in the Netherlands and the challenges of being far from home in the form of a poem

fields.title: The Endless Way
fields.abstract: 15 illegal immigrants from Mali and Senegal arrive on the coast of Spain and soon after are detained by the police; these immigrants express their experiences and daily life struggles of arriving to Spain

fields.title: Iraq's Unwanted People
fields.abstract: The story of gay, Iraqi men forced to flee as a result of restricting LGBTQ+ rights in the country

fields.title: Supplicants
fields.abstract: Illegal Immigrants arriving from various regions around the world arrive in Europe and stay for 3 months, while begging not to be sent back to their country of origin

fields.title: Ghorba- Lengende
fields.abstract: Two immigrants arrive illegally to France and hope for a better life

fields.title: Bucharest: Year of the Dragon
fields.abstract: Illegal and legal refugees who are currently navigating the social and economic lifestyle and challenges of Bucharest

fields.title: Those Who Feel the Fire Burning
fields.abstract: Surveys the living conditions and daily struggles of those forced to hide, work illegally, and live in unfit conditions when seeking refuge in Europe

fields.title: Tarifa Sea
fields.abstract: Looks at the people of Tarifa whose everyday life is influenced by the constant flow of illegal immigrants, searching for a better future in "fortress Europe.”
fields.notes: Copyright by German Film & Television Academy

fields.title: Superior Orders
fields.abstract: Illegal refugees from Afghanistan, Mali, and Ghana, who face tremendous amounts of struggle and resistance when trying to enter into the European Union from patrolling, border control, and the threat of detainment

fields.title: Tomorrow Would Be Another Day
fields.abstract: Immigrants and refugees from Turkey and Afghanistan share their experiences on living in Greece for a decade

fields.title: 2 Hours
fields.abstract: The border between Morocco and Spain has been a contentious issue, for those who are fortunate enough to cross into Spain, it offers a sense of safety, especially compared to the Moroccan side of the fence

fields.title: Mineo Housing
fields.abstract: A former military compound is turned into a fenced-in refugee shelter in Sicily, Italy and becomes the centerpiece of the film which explores the wire of the fence, the policies keeping refugees in the shelter, and lack of essential services in the shelter

fields.title: On a Distance
fields.abstract: Immigrants from Kazakhstan waiting to be naturalized within Belgium discuss their difficulties leaving and communicating with those back home

fields.title: Yolki Palki
fields.abstract: Russian immigrants to Israel explore their new lives in an unfamiliar country

fields.title: Bref
fields.abstract: Immigrants discussing the topic of female genital mutilation

fields.title: Callshop
fields.abstract: Immigrants from Cameroon and Tunisia call home to their loved ones in a busy train station in Munich

fields.title: Lampedusa-Paris: Travel Journal
fields.abstract: After the Arab Spring uprising in Tunisia, refugees and immigrants escape into Italy and continue on to Paris

fields.title: Lampedusa Safe Landing
fields.abstract: Immigration discussion from the perspective of the mayor, a priest, the chief of the coast guard, and a lawyer in Italy

fields.title: Memories from the Tobacco Factory
fields.abstract: The film features interviews with many of these children, now elderly people, who recall their poverty stricken but happy years in Budapest, a look into the life of the Greek Diaspora in Hungary

fields.title: Salaam Aleykum Copenhagen
fields.abstract: Immigrants from Turkey, Kurdistan, and Lebanon, who discuss their daily lives and the process of integration in Europe

fields.title: All White Barking
fields.abstract: Local inhabitants in London are having trouble accepting the thousands of immigrants and refugees flowing into the country from Nigeria, Uganda, Albania, and Poland

fields.title: Ghosts
fields.abstract: A Chinese immigrant risks their life to get smuggled into the UK and then works for very low pay

fields.title: Homo Ludens: Diary of a Theatre Project
fields.abstract: A Hungarian Roma is asked to participate in a film to chronicle the struggle of Roma people in Hungary

fields.title: Well-Founded Fear
fields.abstract: Investigating the complications of subjectivity during the asylum-seeking process specifically in the U.S., this film narrates from the perspective of the officers granting asylum

fields.title: Close-Up Kurdistan
fields.abstract: An immigrant/refugee retraces his journey back to Kurdish Turkey to cover the ongoing struggle between the Kurds and Turkish government

fields.title: The Face of the Revolution In Search of a Girl from Budapest
fields.abstract: After a picture was taken of her, a young woman has to flee Hungary during the revolution. Her life after she flees is traced by a historian and journalist

fields.title: War Kids
fields.abstract: Internally displaced refugees from Bosnia and Serbia, a story told through the eyes of Muslim and Serbian teenagers in and around Sarajevo.

fields.title: #Syria
fields.abstract: Through social media, refugees and activists are able to help spread information and connect people around the country and the globe to the struggle in Syria

fields.title: We Cannot Go There Now, My Dear
fields.abstract: Narratives from double refugees, originally from Palestine and now forced to flee again, this time from Syria

fields.title: Not Anymore: A Story of Revolution
fields.abstract: A soldier and a journalist chronicle the Syrian revolution

fields.title: In Absentia
fields.abstract: Highlights the dangers of being a refugee, including mass kidnappings, while also escaping atrocities back home

fields.title: The Shebabs of Yarmouk
fields.abstract: Minors about to transition into adulthood describe living a majority of their lives within refugee camps from Palestine and Kurdistan.

fields.title: Good Kurds, Bad Kurds: No Friends but the Mountains
fields.abstract: Kurdish refugees in the United States struggle to garner media attention to the Kurdish struggle in and with Turkey

fields.title: Return to Homs
fields.abstract: Two young men who start off as leaders of the protests of President Assad in Syria, return home to Homs to find a city falling apart
With the destruction in Syria, and the rise of ISIS in Iraq and Syria, the Yazidi minority in largely Kurdish parts of those nations face increasing daily threats to their existence and culture

fields.title: The Liberace of Baghdad
fields.abstract: Introduces the challenging question of leaving home/becoming a refugee or staying in one's country of origin

fields.title: Under Siege
fields.abstract: Palestinian refugee who fled Iraq after the fall of Hussein. Now living in Delhi, he desperately wants to return to his home country and be reunited with his family

fields.title: Palestine in the South
fields.abstract: While many immigrants and refugees fled to Europe from Palestinian camps in Iraq, some fled to Chile

fields.title: Private Investigation
fields.abstract: The film traces the life of a young, Iraqi woman who emigrated to Sofia for political reasons and was murdered

fields.title: Zero-Degree Orbit
fields.abstract: Analyzes the devastating effects of the Iraq-Iran war on its civilians

fields.title: In Search of Shilan
fields.abstract: The complex relationship of a couple who get separated when one becomes exiled and the other joins a nationalist movement in Kurdistan and their struggle to come back to each other a decade after separating

fields.title: My Promised Land
fields.abstract: Internally displaced refugees in search of work in the wake of Kosovo's violent battle for independence

fields.title: Beyond Reasonable Doubt
fields.abstract: Forced-migrants and internally displaced victims and survivors of the Srebrenica Massacre tell their stories

fields.title: To Endure – Albania Yesterday and Today
fields.abstract: Narratives of political prisoners, victims of labor camps, and the communist regime

fields.title: Crayons and Paper
fields.abstract: Showcases the sometimes overlooked damaging effects of child refugee victims of war and conflict

fields.title: Little Bride
fields.abstract: The perspective of Turkish women sent to forcibly marry as minors in Germany and are exposed to domestic violence and even in some cases, death

fields.title: Between a Star and a Crescent: Father of the Refugees
fields.abstract: Story surrounding the case and murder of a man assisting refugees in conflicts within the Middle East

fields.title: Aliens Everywhere
fields.abstract: Stories of, and from, children living in a refugee camp in Hungary
fields.notes: Verzio Film Festival Submission; Only in Hungarian (no English subtitles)

fields.title: On the Spot-9 Months around the World: Zaatari
fields.abstract: Refugees in the largest refugee camp within Jordan

fields.title: Ghetto 59
fields.abstract: What should have been a temporary refugee camp for refuge during the height of the Bosnian War continues to this day, hear from some of the residents of this refugee enclave

fields.title: Model House
fields.abstract: Story of an ex-Yugoslav refugee residing in Serbia

fields.title: Humanity's Crusade
fields.abstract: Hungarian refugees fleeing after the revolution of 1956

fields.title: Expecting
fields.abstract: Illegal refugees, originating from Afghanistan and Kosovo, wait to hear about the extension of their residency permits

fields.title: Fearful Arrival
fields.abstract: Children refugees in a Hungarian refugee camp whose only opportunity for a holiday is to attend a camp hosted by the NGO "Menedek" who protects refugee rights

fields.title: My Dreams Never Lie
fields.abstract: The perspective from a young, Afghan student refugee seeking refuge in Paris

fields.title: In the Soldier's Footsteps
fields.abstract: Former child soldier refugee living in Denmark

fields.title: Tomorrow You Will Leave
fields.abstract: The narrative of an Austrian villager who decided to help struggling Vietnamese refugees

fields.title: Which Way to Palestine, Please?
fields.abstract: Reflections of the lives and experiences of older Palestinian refugees in Syria contrasted with those of the younger refugees in Syrian refugee camps

fields.title: Promises
fields.abstract: Through the perspective children refugees from Palestine and Israel

fields.title: Fort Europe
fields.abstract: Showcases the treatment of refugees throughout Europe

fields.title: Where the Might Wind Rest?
fields.abstract: Refugees staying in Turkey discussing being away from their homeland

fields.title: Hidden
fields.abstract: Describes the narrative of a hidden refugee child in Sweden
fields.notes: Animation; Film is a donation of the Margaret Mead Festival, supported by OSI-Budapest; No English subtitles

fields.title: Since I was Born
fields.abstract: Outlines the perspective of living inside occupational refugee camps

fields.title: Oh My Lika
fields.abstract: Shows the narrative of refugees trying to rebuild their lives after moving back to their homeland

fields.title: Terminus
fields.abstract: Mentally-handicapped refugees discuss the hardships of their situation in a refugee camp specifically for people with mental illnesses

fields.title: Broken Cities
fields.abstract: Kosovo-Albanian refugees living in London and dealing with the hardships of integration

fields.title: Sound of Torture
fields.abstract: A Swedish reporter uncovers the story of internally displaced refugees who were kidnapped and tortured
fields.notes: Verzio Film Festival Submission, Copyright by Trabelsi Productions, Potential film to watch for ECCHRD

fields.title: Friends and Strangers
fields.abstract: Refugee immigrants from various regions of conflict reflect on the hardship of their situation and their future living in Germany

fields.title: Neither Here Nor There
fields.abstract: Young Palestinian youths facing social and economic hardships decide if immigration and seeking refugee status will be the best solution

fields.title: Never Again?
fields.abstract: Immigrants and internally displaced refugees from Sudan and Chad as well as international activists struggle to understand the lack of action from international leaders

fields.title: Yodok Stories
fields.abstract: Perspective from a North Korean refugee who escaped a labor/concentration camp within the country where hundreds of thousands of individuals face hard labor and torture without any court hearings

fields.title: Afghan Jungle
fields.abstract: Immigrant refugees attempt to get into the EU

fields.title: The Greek Tragedy
fields.abstract: Perspective from the Greek immigrant refugees who have sought refuge in Hungary

fields.title: Between Heaven and Earth
fields.abstract: Chechen refugees in Germany struggle to adapt to life in a big city that is not predominantly Islamic

fields.title: No Peace Without Dignity
fields.abstract: Young Germans visit and discuss the Israeli-Palestinian conflict with local refugees in both regions

fields.title: The Boys from Lebanon
fields.abstract: Refugees rebuilding their lives in Israel after a devastating conflict in Lebanon forced them to flee their home

fields.title: Waiting for Roza
fields.abstract: Focuses on the narrative of a local man who provides insight into the lives of Greek refugees in the 1950s

fields.title: A Minister Backtracks
fields.abstract: Perspective of a previous Danish Minister of Interior who investigates the refugee crisis that resulted from the war in Bosnia

fields.title: Free Space
fields.abstract: Shows the forced migration of Serbs-Croats in the Western part of Croatia

fields.title: Bare Ground
fields.abstract: Shows the racism and ethnic hatred still alive and present in Serbia and the overall hardships refugees returning to their former homes must endure

fields.title: Witnesses of the War
fields.abstract: Eye-Witness accounts from journalists experiencing the conflict between Turkey and the Kurds

fields.title: Where Might the Wind Rest?
fields.abstract: Asylum-seekers flee to Turkey after 2009 elections in Iran

fields.title: The Return of the Aramean People
fields.abstract: Once exiled Aramean Christians from Turkey, arrive back after years of exile and seeking refuge abroad

fields.title: Adopting a New Homeland
fields.abstract: The narrative of population exchange and the forced immigration of Greeks and Turks

fields.title: History of My Family
fields.abstract: Russian intellectuals forced into labor camps and later exiled to Serbia- along with their children
fields.notes: Did not clarify if English subtitles were available

fields.title: Leaving Greece
fields.abstract: Refugees who reach Greece, only to further seek refuge elsewhere in Europe

fields.title: Stories from the Middle East: Journey with Naba
fields.abstract: Told through the eyes of a child refugee in the West Bank

fields.title: Arna's Children
fields.abstract: Young Palestinian refugee children who later became suicide bombers
fields.notes: Verzio Film Festival Submission ; Coproduction: Israel, the Netherlands

fields.title: Letter to Sasha
fields.abstract: A young, refugee girl who decides to contact the daughter of President Obama

fields.title: Message From Behind the Wall
fields.abstract: Analyzing the segregation wall constructed by the Israeli government and a refugee camp that used to be a playground

fields.title: The Heart of Jenin
fields.abstract: Refugee child who was shot and killed by an Israeli soldier

fields.title: Itinerary of a Rebel
fields.abstract: Interesting perspective of a North Korean working in a labor camp in Siberia- later seeks refuge in the U.S.

fields.title: August: A Moment Before the Eruption
fields.abstract: Narrative of tense hatred between Israelis and Palestinians- shot within the setting of a refugee camp

fields.title: Freedom Dance
fields.abstract: Story of a married couple leaving Hungary as refugees
fields.notes: CEU Center for the Arts and Culture

fields.title: The Other Side of the Wall
fields.abstract: Over a hundred thousand internally displaced refugees living in the Saharan desert

fields.title: A Cry from the Grave
fields.abstract: Shows the life and death of thousands of Muslim refugees living in former Yugoslavia

fields.title: Pretty Dyana
fields.abstract: Roma refugees living in Belgrade trying to make a living by producing motorized vehicles made out of scrap parts

fields.title: Our Folk
fields.abstract: Homeless refugees learn to coexist in Poland despite differences

fields.title: Ramleh
fields.abstract: Refugee and immigrant women and the communities they represent struggle to ever find peace amongst their culture, religion, and new homeland

fields.title: Respite
fields.abstract: A look inside of a government "camp" that was responsible for holding Jews and Roma until they could be transported to extermination camps

fields.title: I Have Dreamed of Working as a Hairdresser
fields.abstract: An illegal Roma living in Germany who faces the fears of deportation

fields.title: Hungarian Roma Asylum Seekers in Strasbourg
fields.abstract: Asylum seekers who turned to the European Court of Human Rights

fields.title: Exodus
fields.abstract: Talks of the thousands of Protestants who were forced to leave their area of Derry, Northern Ireland to another part of the city as a result of the conflict between religious groups

fields.title: Package-Tour
fields.abstract: Follows a group of former prisoners of Auschwitz who revisit the camp

fields.title: RESF: A Resistance Network
fields.abstract: Highlights the relationship between European citizens and refugees as well as protesting the conditions refugees are faced with

fields.title: Felvidék: Caught in Between
fields.abstract: Narration of Slovak-Hungarian minority groups often times forced to leave as a result of political boundaries and opposing interests

fields.title: From Home to Home
fields.abstract: Hungarians born outside of the Hungary who wish to resettle back inside the country, face cultural differences that make it difficult to fully integrate

fields.title: Crossing Midnight
fields.abstract: Millions of internally displaced individuals fleeing the armed conflict in Thailand and Burma

fields.title: Personal Belongings
fields.abstract: Immigrants from Hungary who fled to the United States in exile

fields.title: Train of Freedom
fields.abstract: Discusses the story of the nearly one million Albanians who were driven away by Serbian forces in a period of ethnic cleansing

fields.title: Population Exchange
fields.abstract: Discusses the expulsion of Hungarians living in Upper Hungary to Bohemia

fields.title: In Utero Srebrenica
fields.abstract: Presents the stories of some Muslim mothers affected by the genocide in the former Yugoslavia

fields.title: Thistle
fields.abstract: Highlights the memory of the Armenian genocide and the effect it had on the civilians

fields.title: Statement 710399
fields.abstract: A story of a man who lost his son during the Srebrenica genocide as well as a narrative of the war crimes occurring in Bosnia and Herzegovina and their lasting effects

fields.title: Broken Silence
fields.abstract: Discusses the persecution of the Roma and Sinti people during the Holocaust from Poland, Kosovo, and Germany.

fields.title: I am White Mercenary
fields.abstract: Displays the complexities of the Anfal Genocide Campaign against Iraq's Kurdish population

fields.title: Sky Too High, Soil Too Hard
fields.abstract: Survivors of the Srebrenica Genocide recount their experiences leading up to, during, and after the genocide

fields.title: The Endless Column
fields.abstract: Roma groups living in Bologna, Italy since the 1990s and are forcibly evicted from their homes

fields.title: Children of the War
fields.abstract: Salvadoran refugees who formed the gang MS-13, which grew to be one of the largest gang groups in the United States- From the perspective of a refugee movement in the U.S. that proved to be threatening towards the security of the population

fields.title: Goodbye, Our Homeland!
fields.abstract: Ethnic Germans living in Hungary were forced to relocate under Soviet Union control of Hungary

fields.title: Between Fences
fields.abstract: Detained asylum seekers from Eritrea and Sudan who cannot return home, but also cannot be integrated into Israel's society due to the country's policies create a theater workshop to bring attention to those facing persecution and oppression.

fields.title: Bunkers
fields.abstract: Asylum seekers detained in underground shelters dating back to Cold War within Switzerland

fields.title: In My Eyes
fields.abstract: Refugees from Syria, Afghanistan, and the Gambia living in Germany comment on the media portrayal of refugees and express their concerns and viewpoints

fields.title: My Own Private War
fields.abstract: A young woman who fled from the Balkan civil war in the 1990s returns 20 years later to the country

fields.title: Ta'ang
fields.abstract: An ethnic group in Burma seeking refuge during the civil war

fields.title: Evaporating Borders
fields.abstract: Asylum seekers in Cyprus- one of the easiest ports of access into "Fortress Europe" for migrants

fields.title: The Nine Muses
fields.abstract: Homer's "The Odyssey" is reflected over the history of mass migration and overall emigrant experience and journey

fields.title: Burma in Pieces
fields.abstract: The film attempts to offer a detailed, nuanced human perspective of the nature of fear and oppression by bringing the audience into the lives, homes and environments of the Burmese people, thus experiencing their warmth, struggle and sacrifice.

fields.title: A Village On Fire: Burma Diary
fields.abstract: Narrates the story of a young Burmese man forced to flee and to seek refuge in the Burmese and Thai jungle with his wife and two daughters. This film is an overall insightful study of the hopes and obstacles faced by both the people and government of Burma.

fields.title: Dont' Fence Me In: Major Mary and the Karen Refugees from Burma
fields.abstract: Major Mary's charismatic storytelling is accompanied by rare, clandestine footage smuggled out of the refugee camps along the border between Burma and Thailand. The film reveals the Karen refugees' spirit and determination to survive as political and historical forces conspire against them.

fields.title: Cameras for the Invisible Ones
fields.abstract: Dutch author, Karel Glastra van Loon, tells his wife before his death to bring cameras to the Burmese refugees. This film overall showcases the emotional journey and lives of these people.

fields.title: Last Kiss
fields.abstract: Images of fighting between Myanmar's military and the Kachin Independence Army--and the refugee camps in Laiza endangered by the civil war

fields.title: Minor Border
fields.abstract: Minor Border' looks into a changing meaning of borders in the European Union whose citizens are increasingly polarized on the issues of migration and free population movements.

fields.title: I Wait for You Here
fields.abstract: Through interviews and on the scene footage, the film exposes the reality of the constant flow of people trying to get to the US. Many of the hopeful who come to Tijuana to cross the border, end up living their lives watching the border wall every waking minute, without being able to cross it.

fields.title: Iraq: The Lost Generation
fields.abstract: In the past five years more than four million Iraqis – 20 percent of the entire population – have been driven from their homes as a result of the war and sectarian bloodshed. Two million have become exiles, living desperate lives across the border in Syria and Jordan.

fields.title: Wounded Night
fields.abstract: Displaced from the countryside due to violence, Blanca has recently moved to a rudimentary shelter on the Bogota border with her three grandsons.

fields.title: The Land Between
fields.abstract: For most migrants living in Gourougou, their dream is to enter Melilla, an autonomous Spanish city, a European enclave in Africa located on the northern coast of Morocco. The two continents are separated by a barrier built and funded by the European Union, constructed for the sole purpose of keeping African migrants out of Europe.

fields.title: 50 Feet From Syria
fields.abstract: Illustrates the current plight of Syrian refugees and the human cost of one of the most brutal, dehumanizing conflicts in modern history that continues to destroy and displace millions of lives.

fields.title: The Invisibles
fields.abstract: The Invisibles' follows four asylum seekers from Syria, Cameroon, and Kenya on their journey through official migration proceedings in Germany, and are not warmly received. It showcases the overall ineffectiveness of asylum law.

fields.title: Ceuta: Prison by the Sea
fields.abstract: Ceuta is a small Spanish enclave in northern Morocco. After months of travel, some clandestine migrants are able to cross one of the last walled borders in Europe. They are indefinitely placed in the CETI, a temporary retention center, with no rights, where they live between the slender hope of obtaining a pass to enter Europe and the fear of being sent home.

fields.title: Shout
fields.abstract: Two young boys currently living on Israeli-occupied territory are determined to start their life by crossing the border and into Syria. They soon run into various challenges and hardships that force them to choose between a future they have always dreamed of and the security of living back home.

fields.title: Peshawar Rubab
fields.abstract: Two respected musicians from Afghanistan were suddenly forced to flee their home country of Afghanistan for Pakistan. Upon arrival, they founded an artist colony, where different schools of musicians gather regularly to practice their craft

fields.title: Refugees
fields.abstract: At the height of the Greek Civil War, the Greek Communist Party and the Red Cross evacuated thousands of children from Aegean Macedonia under bombardment by British and US-backed Greek forces. The film explains the common story for a generation of ethnic Macedonian children, forced to flee their homeland, scattered across Europe and the world, unlikely to ever return home.

fields.title: Sierra Leone’s Refugee All Stars
fields.abstract: Sierra Leone’s Refugee All Stars is a band of six musicians who have been living as refugees in the Republic of Guinea after a brutal civil war forced them to flee their country. Many of their family members were murdered in the conflict, leaving them with physical and emotional scars. Despite the traumas of the war these musicians have found refuge in reggae music, singing of the experiences of so many struggling to survive.

fields.title: Stories from Lakka Beach
fields.abstract: The film narrates five locals with differing perspectives and expresses their lives and the change in dynamics since the outbreak of the war in Sierra Leone. Although thousands of refugees still wish to not return to their country, these individuals offer an insight into the challenges and obstacles of overcoming war, conflict, and hardship.

fields.title: The Boy Who Plays on the Buddhas of Bamiyan
fields.abstract: This film, shot over the course of a year, focuses on one of the refugees who now live among the ruins of the Buddha's of Bamiyan: an 8-year-old boy called Mir. Through Summer, Winter and Spring we follow Mir's life - the scrapes, the fun and the naughtiness - against the magnificent backdrop of Bamiyan and its ruined statues. This film analyzes the purity of childhood and coming to understand violence and conflict for the first time in young child's life.

fields.title: Children of Congo: From War to Witches
fields.abstract: The film also examines the efforts to reintegrate disarmed child soldiers, refugees, and orphaned children following the eruption of the massive Nyiragongo volcano, near the city of Goma in Eastern Congo. These heroic efforts are finally bringing some measure of hope and stability to the lives of the Congolese people.

fields.title: Displaced
fields.abstract: Six Western aid-workers are trying to help the refugees build a new life. With unprecedented candor they talk about their ideals, doubts, disappointments and desires.

fields.title: Little Lhasa
fields.abstract: Dharamsala is the seat of the Tibetan government in exile, the Dalai Lama's official residence and a place of hope for the thousands of refugees leaving Tibet, crossing the icy mountains of the Himalayas in search of a better future. The film follows the Tibetan community in exile and exposes their struggles to preserve their cultural and spiritual heritages.

fields.title: Palestine is Still the Issue
fields.abstract: Filmmaker Tony Stark previously filmed a documentary in 1977 about the millions of Palestinian people and refugees forced from their homeland in 1948. 25 years later he returns to Israel and the West Bank only to find these refugees still in limbo trapped in one of the longest military occupations in modern history.

fields.title: Photonovela
fields.abstract: A 12 year old girl must complete family history assignment for school. The boring task slowly becomes a drama embodying many secrets and encompassing three generations of one family, beginning before the Second World War, continuing with Holocaust refugees and ending with the fall of the collective kibbutz idealism.

fields.title: Far From the Village
fields.abstract: In April 2006, 13,000 members of the Dajo ethnic group have taken refuge on the plain of Gouroukoun in eastern Chad. They are all survivors of the Darfur conflict. Secluded in the camp they have constructed, they create their own way of life and means of survival. The filmmaker joins the refugees in this prison without walls, capturing everyday life as it is gradually re-embraced.

fields.title: Identity
fields.abstract: In India, the Reangs, who form the second largest ethnic tribal group in Tripura, cling to their traditional way of life as shifting cultivators and seek to convince their leaders about the necessity to form an autonomous district council in Mizoram. When the request is being brought forward to then chief minister Lal Thanhawla, it meets strong opposition, which causes the already existing tensions between the two communities to escalate. A decade later, close to 35000 Reangs are refugees in Tripura, after fleeing from Mizoram due to ethnic violence.

fields.title: Bullets No More
fields.abstract: In Kenya in 2007 – 2008, the violence following the elections rocked the nation. It brings into focus the plight of the refugees and the suffering of the internally displaced people. It takes the viewer on an extensive journey, following the events closely as they began, carried on and finally ended with the results of the election being released and the Peace Accord being signed.

fields.title: Dinka Diaries
fields.abstract: The story of some of America's most recent arrivals: Sudanese refugees who would have never dreamt a few years ago that they'd be living in America. Over the course of ten months, the film follows the lives of three Sudanese refugees who resettle in the Philadelphia area and adjust to the new American culture and way of life. Dinka Diaries represents an important attempt to empower refugees by giving them the opportunity to represent themselves and their experiences through film.

fields.title: A Walnut Tree
fields.abstract: The story of an elder refugee man who reminisces on living in his native land the Tirah Valley before being forced to flee to a refugee camp in Pakistan as a result of the ongoing violence and conflict in the region.

fields.title: Fate of the Lhapa
fields.abstract: The last three Tibetan shamans (lhapas) are living in a Tibetan refugee camp in Nepal with no other descendants to carry on their healing practices while a younger generation is attending school, assimilating, and modernizing. These "sucking doctors" are practicing a dying tradition.

fields.title: End of the Land
fields.abstract: The story of Afghan refugees traveling to Iran and the Netherlands on September 11th, 2001 and their subsequent repatriation to Afghanistan after the fall of the Taliban regime.

fields.title: My Mother Told Me
fields.abstract: A young woman tells the story of her family’s destruction during the war in Cambodia, 1975-1978. Later, as a refugee living with her mother in Sydney, Australia, she suffers an identity crisis that is linked to the unexplained circumstances of her birthday and the mystery of the father that she never knew.

After the extremist Islamic group ‘Daesh’ attacked the Izadi (Yazidi) Kurds, they held a great number of Kurdish women and girls and started raping and selling them. The protagonist, Nasrin, escaped from the terrorist group ‘Daesh’ and is now telling us the story of her journey and the tales of the other war refugee women that she met along the way.

fields.title: Hunted Like Animals
fields.abstract: A film about the Hmong Lao people who are permanently persecuted by both the Laotian and the Vietnamese military. In recent years, over 8,500 Hmong have escaped from Laos to Thailand, where they are placed into temporary refugee camps. Hmong Lao refugees speak about their plight, and their fear of being deported from Thailand to join thousands of people still trapped in the jungle, living in constant danger of abuse by soldiers.

fields.title: Rosa Remembers Palestine
fields.abstract: A documentary featuring an interview with a Palestinian refugee, "Rosa", who was one of the thousands of Palestinians who had to leave their homes and businesses when Israel was created.

fields.title: Women, War & Peace: The War We Are Living
fields.abstract: In Cauca, a mountainous region in Colombia’s Pacific southwest, two extraordinary Afro-Colombian women are braving a violent struggle over their gold-rich lands and are standing up for a generation of Colombians who have been terrorized and forcibly displaced as a deliberate strategy of war.

fields.title: Silence or Exile
fields.abstract: Four authors talk about the reasons for their flight and the creative process in exile after threats in their home countries.

fields.title: Exile Family Movie
fields.abstract: The bittersweet story of a family torn apart by politics, scattered across continents, divided by cultures, and their attempt to come together for their first true family reunion in decades.

fields.title: Vuelta y Vuelta: Memories of the Chilean Exile
fields.abstract: During the 17 years of dictatorship in Chile, hundreds of thousands of Chileans were forced to leave their country. Three collective theatre workshops in Sweden, Austria and Chile were the starting point to work with some of the Chileans on topics like being in exile and its further consequences.

fields.title: Search in the Silence
fields.abstract: During the dictatorship in Chile supported by General Augusto Pinochet 1,600,000 people went into exile and many did not return after the regime fell. They formed families and settled there for the rest of their lives and the effects of living in exile on new generations.

fields.title: Memories of a Dreamer: The Journey of a Political Prisoner
fields.abstract: A first-person account of the hardship suffered by a political prisoner in Chile in 1973 under a cruel dictatorship. Felix Mora recounts shocking details of the torture he endured, his escape from the dictatorship and the challenges he has faced as an exile in Italy and Canada.

fields.title: Chechen-Russian War
fields.abstract: Various televised news programs outlining the context and overall severity of the war in Chechnya. It further displays multiple refugee camps and asylum centers during the coverage as well.

fields.title: The Turtle's Rage
fields.abstract: The story of an enigmatic man whose life is shaped by flight, expulsion, exile, and a failed attempt to return to Palestine. It is the story of a journey through Egypt, Palestine and Jordan, a story so nuanced as to thwart the simplified notions of victim and perpetrator, good and evil, black and white.

fields.title: Special Circumstances
fields.abstract: The documentary follows Hector, a formerly jailed and tortured dissident teen, as he returns to Chile almost 30 years later, camera in hand, to confront the perpetrators and his former captors looking for answers and justice.

fields.title: Lost Land
fields.abstract: Straddling a 2,400-kilometer-long wall constructed by the Moroccan army, the Western Sahara is today divided into two sections - one occupied by Morocco, the other under the control of the Sahrawi National Liberation Movement's Polisario Front. Drawing from stories of flight, exile, interminable waiting and the arrested, persecuted lives on both sides of that wall. This film bears witness to the Sahrawi people, their land, and their entrapment in other people's dreams.

fields.title: Shigey, My Flame
fields.abstract: Tewolde Redda is a famous Eritrean singer and a former freedom fighter currently living in the Netherlands. 'Shigey Habuni' (Give me my flame) was his most famous song. Why doesn't he sing it anymore? The song lives on in the hearts of all Eritreans around the world. It became a symbol of the long, harsh fight against the Ethiopian occupation. Nowadays Eritrea is an independent country, but the writer and singer of this song, Tewolde Redda, seems to be forgotten: alone with his memories, he lives in exile, refusing to sing his famous song again.

fields.title: East Timor, Birth of a Nation. Episode One: Rosa's Journey
fields.abstract: This is the story of Rosa Martins, a 26 year old widow and mother of six children whose father was killed and mother starved to death while fleeing from invading Indonesian forces in 1975. Now, with the Indonesians gone Rosa travels to the distant towns of Venilale and Los Palos where three of her children live in orphanages.

fields.title: Death of a Nation: The Timor Conspiracy
fields.abstract: John Pilger and his crew, slipped into East Timor and made this film. In the 18 years that passed, an estimated 200,000 East Timorese, 1/3 of the population, had been slaughtered by the Indonesian military. Pilger tells the story through interviews with Timorese exiles and Australian, British, and Indonesian diplomats.

fields.title: In the Name of the Father
fields.abstract: The story of a young Swedish - Chilean and his emotional scars, inner turmoil and trauma resulting from a life in exile and the absence of a father brutally assassinated by the military regime of Chile’s Augusto Pinochet.

fields.title: Viera Gran
fields.abstract: A Polish singer who just began to reach her peak in popularity right before the start of World War II. Though her family survived the liquidation of the Warsaw ghetto, they were accused of collaboration after the war, and had to flee to Israel and later Venezuela and France to escape the stigma of collaborator.

fields.title: Before the Revolution
fields.abstract: Showcases Israel and Iran's friendly relations until the Iranian revolution of 1979 broke out in which many Israelis living in Tehran were forced to flee for their lives.

fields.title: Gzim Rewind
fields.abstract: A film about the multitude of transformations of a young boy experiencing war and violence in which he has no other choice than to flee into Western Europe.

fields.title: Sky Hook
fields.abstract: Amidst NATO bombings in Belgrade, a family decides to build a basketball court to bring a sense of normalcy into their lives and soon individuals from throughout their community come together to rebuild the court, all while trying to obtain visas to flee to Italy.

fields.title: A Kosovo Fairytale
fields.abstract: In the midst of war, a family from Kosovo flees to Finland leaving the youngest son behind. This touching tale is their message to the little brother as they try to explain their reasons for leaving him behind. Told through animation and footage of the family using the internet to communicate a message, the film takes the form of a fairytale as it highlights the human tragedies surrounding civil war.

fields.title: Bodies for Sale
fields.abstract: Narration of the historical abuse of the Rohingya refugees from Burma using compelling footage and storytelling.

fields.title: Dammed
fields.abstract: Locals in an Indian village began to protest when their lands were submerged as the level of water began to rise in an catchment area of a dam that the government started to build without their authorization. This film showcases the dark realities of those affected by environmental causes and conflicts, which has encompassed billions of victims since the 1990s.

fields.title: No Place on Earth
fields.abstract: In attempt to find refuge until the Soviet occupation reached Ukraine, thirty-eight people of all ages escaped to the caves for nearly 18 months to avoid deportation – the longest underground survival in recorded human history.

fields.title: Formosa Dream, Disrupted
fields.abstract: Villagers who become displaced by a large earthquake and struggle to rebuild their lives and homes.

fields.title: Bam in the Second Zero
fields.abstract: A film about survivors of the tragic earthquake in Bam, Iran, 2003. The tragic events are related by the patients of the Amir Alam hospital, in Tehran, where many of the earthquake victims were treated.

fields.title: Kassim the Dream
fields.abstract: At a young age, Kassim, a famous boxer now residing in the United States, was forced to become a child soldier within a rebel army in Uganda. After several years of living in fear of his own life and safety, he went to the U.S. to seek asylum. This film shows the journey of his time in the U.S., his ultimate culture shock and his desire to see his family, which the only way that could occur is if he received a military pardon from the U.S. government directly.

fields.title: Life Sentences
fields.abstract: This stunningly complex Arab-Jewish family history is introduced by Nimer Ahmed, the son of Fauzi al Nimer, an Arab from Acca, and a Jewish woman from Nahariya. Having married in the 1960s, the couple lived in quiet harmony with their two children until there came a shocking discovery that Fauzi was responsible for 22 terrorist attacks in Israel. After the father is caught and sentenced for life, the mother decides to leave the country and settle in Canada, where no one suspects the real identity of the children.

fields.title: Vukovar
fields.abstract: A true love story of a newly married Croat and Serb couple who quickly become separated by the war. Toma, from Serbia, quickly becomes enlisted in the Yugoslav army while Anna, pregnant at the time, heads off to Zagreb to seek safety after her parents are killed by the war.

fields.title: Qana
fields.abstract: Qana tells the story of the massacre of the civilians of Qana, a Lebanese village, who took refuge in a UN base in 1996.

fields.title: Believing in Survival
fields.abstract: Yossi Steiner is a leader of the Jewish community in Kosice since 2001. As a child he escaped the deportation of Jews in Kassa by moving to Hungary. After three years of persecution they returned to Czechoslovakia. Later, as many other Jews he emigrated into Israel, but his faith brought him back to Kosice, Slovakia.

fields.title: Lovebirds: Rebel Lovers in India
fields.abstract: In India, lovebirds are young lovers that put their life on the line to stay together by escaping their families and persecution from India’s ancient tradition of prohibiting marriage outside one’s caste or religion. A poor shelter in New Delhi provides the chance for some to share their stories.

fields.title: The Zagreb Fair
fields.abstract: The film is about the fully unknown and dark side of the happenings that took place within the Zagreb Fair compound in the autumn of 1991, the year in which the war broke out. First established as a mobilisation center of police reserve forces, it soon became a transit camp and persecution center.

fields.title: Carousel
fields.abstract: Grandparents, Holocaust survivors themselves, together with their family members – children and grandchildren – talk about how the memories of being persecuted might influence their daily lives.

fields.title: Helen K, Edited Testimony: Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies
fields.abstract: In the framework of an oral history interview a survivor of the Warsaw Ghetto, Majdanek and Auschwitz relates her wartime experiences and describes her postwar reunion with her husband, whom she had married in the ghetto at the age of 16. She emphasizes her determination to survive as an act of defiance against Hitler, a decision she reached when her younger brother died in her arms in the cattle car en route to Majdanek.

fields.title: Among Blind Fools
fields.abstract: Documentary about the fate of Slovak Jews during the Holocaust and a rabbi, Michael Weissmandl, who rescued thousands of Slovak Jews.

fields.title: Here I learned to Love
fields.abstract: Two brothers revisit their experiences during the Holocaust leading them to travel from Krakow to Budapest to Bergen Belsen to Switzerland on a journey to remember.

fields.title: Paying for Justice
fields.abstract: The filmmakers follow the billions of dollars transferred from the German governments and other European governments to Holocaust survivors as compensation for those who managed to live through the Nazi terror. In an attempt to end their life with dignity, some of the 270,000 Holocaust survivors in Israel migrate back to Germany, where they can receive financial support and formal recognition as Holocaust survivors.

fields.title: The Wagon
fields.abstract: The film discusses one of the most horrible aspects of the Holocaust: the delivery of the deported people to the lagers and the days spent in the wagons.

fields.title: Faces: Memories from the Shoah
fields.abstract: Holocaust victims and survivors giving their testimonies and personal narratives of life within the concentration camps.

fields.title: Toll Station
fields.abstract: Two Holocaust survivors who were liberated from Mauthausen in 1945 talk about daily life inside the camp. The film revisits the site of the concentration camp, which is now a memorial and an educational museum for visitors, and follows a school group on a tour of the facility

fields.title: The Chronicle of an Extermination
fields.abstract: The documentary attempts a reenactment of the Chortiatis holocaust during Nazi occupation, through first-hand testimony of eyewitnesses and putting forward the significance of historical memory preservation. The unravelling of events is shaped by official sources and through the individual perspectives and personal experiences of common people, shedding new light on these historical events.

fields.title: Forgotten Transport to Estonia
fields.abstract: On 5th of September 1942 a transport arrived in Estonia bearing one thousand Czech Jews. Roughly a hundred women between the ages of 19 and 25 were separated from their families who were taken by bus to another camp

fields.title: Line 41
fields.abstract: After losing contact with his brother and parents in the Lodz/Litzmannstadt Ghetto 70 years before, one survivor returns to try to piece together his family's experiences in hopes of finding his brother

fields.title: Mum
fields.abstract: In a hope to protect her children from the horrors of the Holocaust, a Jewish immigrant to Canada converts to Christianity

fields.title: Kovno Ghetto: A Buried History
fields.abstract: The courageous inmates of the Kovno ghetto risked their lives to record their fate in thousands of photographs and documents, many of which survived the war, stashed away in hiding places, buried underneath the rubble, etc and recounts the citizens livelihoods from pre-war until several days before liberation by Allied troops. They are the most complete record of any Jewish community's experience during the Holocaust.

fields.title: Valea Plangerii
fields.abstract: Surviving Roma victims of brutal forced migration by Nazi and Romanian troops during World War II recount their experiences

fields.title: Fighter
fields.abstract: A documentary about two men in their seventies with a bond between them – both Holocaust survivors and Czech/American émigrés, who left Prague as dissidents under the Communist regime.

fields.title: 2 Girls
fields.abstract: ‘2 Girls’ tells the story of Lota and Tigist, two girls living in two very different countries, Bangladesh and Ethiopia. They are, however, linked by the same journey; both born in rural areas facing poverty and abuse, their only option was to run away. They embark on parallel, harsh journeys through which they meet their destinies

fields.title: Alisa in Warland
fields.abstract: Protagonist Alisa is a 26-year-old student at the film academy in Kiev. Her life was pretty normal until the day that President Viktor Yanukovych refused to sign the EU-Ukraine Association Agreement. Suddenly, everything changed, protests erupted in the capital, with the inhabitants demanding the president’s resignation. Alisa witnessed the demonstrations and in this documentary embarks on a trip through Ukraine in an attempt to understand the war.

fields.title: Angela
fields.abstract: In rural Transylvania, a young Roma girl is preparing to give birth. While following her daily journey, the viewers are invited to piece together her past from bits and pieces we are told, how she was kidnapped to be married and later saved by her future husband. As their love story unfolds, we get to know her family’s struggles and the challenges they face as Transylvanian Roma whilst trying to integrate into society. Although facing an uncertain future while her husband is far away, Angela finds relief and hope in her faith, reminding the viewers that 'what God promises, stands before family'.

fields.title: Faces: Memories From Shoah
fields.abstract: Holocaust and concentration camp survivors give testimony about their lives in Kamianets-Podilskyi; Auschwitz, Mauthausen and Buchenwald concentration camps. The recording focuses on the faces of the witnesses, and include some archival footage as well.
fields.notes: The film was collected for at yellow-star-houses project in 2014.

fields.title: Arlette: Courage is a Muscle
fields.abstract: A journey from Africa to Europe becomes an unexpected journey from childhood to adulthood for our protagonist, Arlette, a 15-year old girl from the Central African Republic who suffered severe injuries during the most recent war. Stranded in Berlin, the young girl faces the challenges of living in a new culture and amongst a language she doesn't speak.

fields.title: To Auschwitz out of Love
fields.abstract: This film is built on personal story by Andras Garai, who tells the story of his three lives: before Auschwitz, in Auschwitz, and after Auschwitz. He could have avoided deportation, but he gave himself up to the Gestapo at the age of 16 to be with his sweetheart Agi in the ghetto and were deported to Auschwitz, where they got separated and struggled to survive the concentration camp.

fields.title: Barakeden: The Little House Maids of Bamako
fields.abstract: Oumou left her village when she was 14 to come to work as a maid in Bamako. Like hundreds of thousands of others, she endures a harsh life with hope for a better life. By night, these "little maids" gather to express their resentment. Helped by a group of activists, some of them begin to organize themselves so as to defend their rights. Meanwhile, one maid named Hawa is about to leave her village and come for the first time to the city.

fields.title: Blue Sky From Pain
fields.abstract: Blue Sky From Pain' portrays the story of a man who is imprisoned without an understanding of why. Director Stephanos Mangriotis asks where he is, and how long he will be there for. He adopts images from abandoned detention centers for migrants in Greece and reconstructs visuals of a narrative that could have taken place there.

fields.title: Bodies for Sale
fields.abstract: A short film about the abuse suffered by Rohingya minorities at the hands of traffickers, as they embark on a sea journey to Malaysia, fearing death and persecution in Burma.
fields.notes: Warning: the film contains highly graphic Images.

fields.title: In Milad's Smile
fields.abstract: In Nahr El Bared, a Palestinian camp in the north of Lebanon, the young people prepare for the visit of a European music Band.

fields.title: District Zero
fields.abstract: District Zero' narrates the daily life of a tiny mobile phone shop in one of the largest refugee camps in the world. The filmmakers ask us to question the role of a smartphone in the life of a refugee. The devices contain clues to individuals identities; their past, including friends and family, it also reveals some of the memories they may have had to flee from.

fields.title: Eat Your Children
fields.abstract: Eat Your Children' is an activist film that attempts to document the invisible. It tells the story of a road-trip taken by two friends attempting to emigrate from Ireland during the financial crash of 2008. The narrative follows the young women during their return to Ireland to probe the country about it's so-called acceptance of debt and austerity. The film immerses us into the worlds of the protagonist-come-filmmakers, two Irish women living and working in London and Barcelona, who return to Ireland to discover the modern incarnations of Irish identity, post-colonialism, nationalism, globalization and resistance.

fields.title: Iron
fields.abstract: “Eisen”, Iron, is how they call the town of Eisenhüttenstadt at the German-Polish border, where the film draws portraits of asylum seekers from all over the world among impressions of a dreary life in a strictly composed sequence of images.

fields.title: Enslaved
fields.abstract: Constantinos Sophocleous' 'Enslaved' is an animation based on a young girl and her journey to escape human trafficking and prostitution.

fields.title: Ernesto and Hildegard
fields.abstract: Ernesto and Hildegard' is a documentary about a Peruvian student who came to Germany shortly before World War II to study medicine. During his time there, he was taken to a concentration camp as he attempted to marry a German girl but was granted freedom for helping the camp's doctor. Once he had left the concentration camp, he was employed by the Consul of Switzerland, where he aided Jewish people, political prisoners and other prisoners in their attempt to leave Germany.

fields.title: Eurovillage
fields.abstract: In the middle of a forest in Belgium, a former holiday resort, Eurovillage, was converted in 2011 to become a reception centre for asylum seekers. Suspended in an uncertain gap in time, the asylum seekers wait in the remote Eurovillage for the answer about their destiny in Belgium.

fields.title: It's Not Only Trash But a Source of Research
fields.abstract: A group of researchers at the Hungarian Ethnographic Museum are using items left behind by refugees at the Serbian-Hungarian border as a source of information on immigrant culture.

fields.title: Fighting for Nothing to Happen
fields.abstract: The film partners up with a Christian NGO in its intention to push forward a relocation project after a volcanic eruption in Eastern Indonesia. A concerned host community, unclear land rights, a corrupt government and restless refugees challenge the protagonist and his companions in their attempts to build the community back up. 'Fighting for Nothing to Happen' documents forced migration outside of the European context.

fields.title: Four Passports
fields.abstract: Four Passports' is a partly-animated documentary told from the perspective of filmmaker Mihajlo Jevtić, based on issues of migration and identity in the aftermath of former Yugoslavia dissolution. The narrative follows four passports and one country, a farewell 25 years in the making. Combining present-day footage, his family's super-8 archives and some animation, the documentary follows Jevtić as he collects the 'token' images and memories that he will pack into his suitcase when he leaves the country.

fields.title: Frontier Messages
fields.abstract: Frontier Messages' by Xuban Intxausti is a documentary filmed in Ceuta as part of Europa Transit, one of the travelling embassies of San Sebastian 2016 European Capital of Culture. The film follows Sergi Cámara, a documentary photojournalist who has spent more than ten years working at the Southern frontier of Europe. His project is to photograph immigrants who have been living on the continent for some time now and ask them to leave a message to those who have just crossed the border. The photographs and messages will be displayed in the Centre for Temporary Stay of Immigrants in Ceuta, where more than 800 people are waiting for the Spanish Ministry of the Interior to authorise their move to the Peninsula.

fields.title: Detained
fields.abstract: Detained' is an absorbing observation from within the walls of a Swedish immigration detention center for rejected asylum seekers. The film follows detainees and staff over the course of one summer. A mother separated from her sons faces deportation, a young man waits for his life to begin, and staff members struggle with the impersonal code of conduct required of their job. With great sensibility to its characters and environment, 'Detained' depicts the silent psychological horror faced by those held in modern detention centers and questions this crucial, global phenomenon.

fields.title: German Concentration Camps Factual Survey
fields.abstract: Unfortunately, an ambitious Allied project to create a feature-length visual report that would damn the Nazi regime and shame the German people into acceptance of Allied occupation had missed its moment, and was left unfinished and shelved. Even in its incomplete form, the film was immensely powerful, generating an awed hush among audiences. But now, complete to six reels, this faithfully restored and definitive version produced by the Imperial War Museums and with a newly recorded narration by actor Jasper Britton, has been rightfully compared with Alain Resnais' Night and Fog (1955).

fields.title: If I Want to do Voluntary Work, This is the Best Place to do it
fields.abstract: A day in the life of Hungarian Migration Aid volunteers at the Hegyeshalom border crossing between Hungary and Austria during the refugee crisis in 2015.

fields.title: Happy Together
fields.abstract: Somewhere in China, there is a small town called Estate of Chinese-Czechoslovak Friendship. In the 1950s, farmers from Czechoslovakia brought tractors and other farming equipment to China as a way of promoting friendship between socialist countries. In order to promote friendship between nations, young Czech sinologist, Tomáš Jirsák, alias Havran [Czech for "Raven"], arrives to this "Chinese Prague" together with his wife and three children and establishes a Department of Czech Studies at a local university. We witness the adaptation of a deeply religious family to a new environment and learn details from typical life in the world's most populous country.

fields.title: He Named Me Malala
fields.abstract: He Named Me Malala' is an intimate portrait of Nobel Peace Prize Laureate Malala Yousafzai, who was targeted by the Taliban and severely wounded by a gunshot when returning home on her school bus in Pakistan’s Swat Valley. The then 15-year-old was singled out, along with her father, for advocating for girls’ education, and the attack on her sparked an outcry from supporters around the world. She miraculously survived and is now a leading campaigner for girls’ education globally as co-founder of the Malala Fund.

fields.title: Believing in Survival
fields.abstract: Yossi Steiner is a leader of the Jewish community in Kosice since 2001. As a child he escaped the deportation of Jews in Kassa by moving to Hungary. After three years of persecution they returned to Czechoslovakia. Later, as did many other Jews, he emigrated into Israel, but his faith brought him back to Kosice, Slovakia.

fields.title: Harbour of Hope
fields.abstract: Harbour of Hope tells the stories of Irene Krausz-Fainman, Ewa Kabacinska Jansson and Joe Rozenberg, who were among the nearly 30,000 survivors rescued from German concentration camps in 1945. They were taken to the Swedish harbour town of Malmö where we see unique archival footage of the three individuals taking their first shaky steps to freedom.

fields.title: Hostages to Misfortune
fields.abstract: Leila, Selim and their 7 children live in Zaatari, a camp for Syrian refugees in Jordan. Filmed over 3 years, this documentary provides an intimate view of their day-to-day life in the camp. Selim, frustrated by enforced idleness, is determined to go back to Syria and fight. How will Leila cope with the birth of her eighth child? This family story is at once extraordinary and typical of millions of refugees who did not choose to leave their country and now face the loss of identity and of choice itself.

fields.title: In Europe's Shadow
fields.abstract: In 2014, together with the journalist Elias Bierdel, a group of filmmakers involved in migration issues travel the external borders of the EU in an attempt to meet activists and refugees and give them a voice.

fields.title: Kafana (Enough, Already!)
fields.abstract: Explores the lives of the exiled Saharawi people in Western Sahara and how they have managed to build a state in the most hostile region of the Algerian hamada. Juan Antonio Moreno and Silvia Venegas' documentary explores the inhabitants feeling of living in this unsustainable situation and how 40 years of exile have affected their understanding and perspective of home.

fields.title: The Two Stories of Adama
fields.abstract: Until eight years ago, Adamà was a forced gold mine laborer in Burkina Faso, exploited twelve hours a day to earn just a dish of rice and beans. Adamà was constantly afraid but he dreamt of finding gold which would allow him to go back to school. And, ultimately, he did go back to school: in Italy. Now he is a university student in Brindisi. He speaks Italian perfectly and, with the elderly people in the village, a fantastic dialect of the Salento area.

fields.title: Line 41
fields.abstract: “LINE 41” documents a Lodz/Litzmannstadt Ghetto and Holocaust survivor's return back to today's Łódź (Poland). Until now, Natan Grossmann had repressed his desire to learn about the fate of his brother to whom he had lost contact in 1942. 70 years later, Grossmann starts a search for his missing brother and traces of his parents who perished in the ghetto. His search crosses paths with Jens-Jürgen Ventzki, son of the former Nazi Head Mayor of Łódź. Ventzki is pursuing his family's dark secret. In tracing their family histories, they inevitably confront each other.

fields.title: Love
fields.abstract: An old couple from the Syrian city of Homs returns after two years of war to discover the remains of their city.

fields.title: Mostly Waiting
fields.abstract: Three men from Zimbabwe who came to South Africa in search of work and a better life, now spend their days on the side of a street, hoping for a job. An intimate look at what it is like to be a homeless refugee living on the streets of an afrophobic country and the dreams that the men have for their futures.

fields.title: NAPPS
fields.abstract: This film tells the story of Mr. X, but his identity and his face are never revealed in it. Mr. X is a West-African asylum seeker living in Berlin without a work permit. As his exposure might put him in danger, he is the one holding the camera instead of appearing in front of it. Mr. X shoots the landscapes and people of Berlin to tell stories about the refugee camp in Italy, about his grandmother in West Africa, about his acquaintance with African drug dealers from Görlitzer Park, and about the relationship between him, his legal status and his camera.

fields.title: Non Assistance
fields.abstract: Thousands of people fleeing ongoing conflicts or in search for a better life are crossing the Mediterranean Sea to seek refuge in Europe. The film consists of interviews conducted with some of these people together with Charles Heller, a young Swiss researcher who participated in the creation of Watch the Med platform which documents and investigates the cases of migrants disappeared at the sea.

fields.title: Oleg's Choice
fields.abstract: In the summer of 2014, thousands of young Russians came to the Donbass region in Eastern Ukraine to take up arms, convinced by the propaganda of Russian state television which persuaded them to carry out their patriotic duty. Among them were Oleg and Max. Oleg was designated commanding officer, and Max became a soldier. Their story took a tragic turn during the night of June 3rd 2015, when Oleg led his men to their death. The battle destroyed a part of the battalion and the two men are now left to face the consequences of their choices.

fields.title: On the Banks of the Tigris
fields.abstract: This musical odyssey uncovers the hidden – and almost erased – story of Iraqi music. 20 years after escaping from Saddam’s regime in 1995, Majid Shokor searches for the source of the songs he loved hearing in Baghdad’s bustling streets and crowded coffeehouses. The Ba’ath Party purged Iraqi music of its origins, and erased the Jewish identity of some of the most famous musicians. Majid sets out to find the truth, as he travels the world to meet exiled musicians who still sing and play these songs. They are reunited in a joyful concert at London’s Barbican Centre, where music and culture are bridges that transcend religion and politics.

fields.title: Once Upon a Time There Were Two Ballerinas
fields.abstract: Éva and Veronika Kolozs are 95 years old, they are the oldest twins in Hungary. Once world-famous ballerinas who danced on some of the world's most renowned stages in Germany and throughout Europe, but their careers were curbed dramatically after the Second World War broke out. They suffered under the control of both fascism and communism and were forcefully relocated, losing their jobs, homes, their lovers, and finally their dreams.

fields.title: Paying the Price: Killing the Children in Iraq
fields.abstract: John Pilger and Alan Lowery travel to Iraq with Denis Halliday, a former assistant secretary-general of the United Nations who resigned in 1998 over what he called the "immoral policy" of economic sanctions. There they find a suffering nation held hostage to the compliance of a dictator, Saddam Hussein, over whom they have no control.

fields.title: Peumulia Jamee
fields.abstract: Unfair citizenship laws in Buddhist-majority Myanmar have rendered the Rohingya Muslims stateless. Desperate for better lives, the Rohingya have been escaping to nearby Southeast Asian countries through illegal smuggling networks. In May 2015, boatloads of Rohingya were left stranded at sea, following collective rejection from Malaysia, Thailand and Indonesia. Thankfully, fishermen from Aceh — a province in Indonesia — spotted the boats and brought them to shore. Despite having found a place of refuge, the Rohingya are escaping from their camps.

fields.title: Presencing: Belehelyezkedni az ottlétbe
fields.abstract: Artemisszió Foundation and Palantír Film Foundation started a project in 2014 wherein co-workers and 12 volunteers were holding intercultural and art workshops for asylum seekers at the reception center in Vámosszabadi, Hungary. This documentary looks at the refugee camp and the project through the eyes of the volunteers.

fields.title: Remember Your Name, Babylon
fields.abstract: The film follows the lives of a group of men and women, brought together in Europe by fate, who crossed the sea from North Africa and the Middle East in search of a better life. They live in a no man’s land, somewhere on the coast of Spain between long rows of hermetically sealed greenhouses, waiting for news of their immigration status.

fields.title: Riding My Tiger
fields.abstract: In his arduous search for a mythical spirit, Breuer recalls the resistance against Dutch colonialism and the conflicts that played out during the Cold War in Indonesia. The film combined autobiographical narrative thread involving the history of the filmmaker´s family and a historical narrative about migration that spans the globe. But before you know it, the spirit materializes, observes the filmmaker, energizes the story´s images, and affects the present. In the form of a shadow it flits through the garden and comments on the complex connections between past and present as a figure in a shadow theater.

fields.title: Road of a Migrant
